label: ABC_cF12_216_a_c_b-001
title: Half–Heusler (AgAsMg, $C1_{b}$) Structure
comments:
All of the atoms are located on the sites of a body-centered cubic lattice. This is sometimes called the ``half–Heusler'' structure because it is identical to the \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2C_cF16_225_a_c_b-001}{$L2_{1}$ (Heusler) structure, Cu$_{2}$AlMn} with half of the copper atoms missing. The Mg and Ag atoms form a \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_cF8_225_a_b-001}{rock salt ($B1$) structure}, while the As and either the Mg or Ag atoms form a \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_cF8_216_a_c-001}{zincblende ($B3$) structure}. If the atoms on the (4a) and (4c) sites are identical, this reduces to the \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2_cF12_225_a_c-001}{fluorite ($C1$) structure}. 
 Other related structures may be found on the \href{current_web_home_dir/ABCD_cF16_216_a_b_c_d-001}{quaternary Heusler page}.
